lines.text: I was in a, in a hospital bed, and I had been operated on. And they had put a, a small receiver in the back of my head and a transmitter in my finger. You know what they are?
A radio?
Yeah, a radio. Anyway, to get at the transmitter, I had to take my fingernail off.
[Nicole is swinging alone on a swingset when she realizes that she's being watched by Peter, who is greatly agitated]
Hello, Nicole.
Who are you?
I'm your father. Do you remember me?
No.
My name's Peter. Your grandmother Gladys is - is my mother.
[she stares at him]
Do you always play by yourself?
Sometimes.
Well, maybe... maybe we could play together.
[she thinks and decides to accept him]
Maybe.

[to her father, Peter]
You don't have a very nice car.
Is my mother really dead?
Yes.
What was she like?

[close to tears]
She was... She wasn't like anyone else. She was different. Really different. There's a lot of people out there who - who want to hurt you. And wherever, wherever, wherever you are. And she was good.
[last lines]
[over the transmitter of a fishing boat]
Hello, hello, Daddy, are you there? Hello, hello, Daddy, are you there? Hello. Daddy, are you there? Hello.
